tool.help:
.. class:: warningmark
**This is a modified version of the Cistrome "Venn Diagram" tool which has been customised for users Galaxy at the University of Manchester**
-----
This tool generates a venn diagram of the intersection of multiple intervals files. The original code was written by Jacqueline Wentz and revised by Tao Liu. It will calculate how many regions are overlapped between BED files and use the Google Chart API to draw the final figure.
.. class:: warningmark
**CAUTION:** If three data sets are used, and their sizes differ a lot then the figure may not be correct - however the numbers will be right.
**CAUTION:** The maximum number of lines in all the input files should not exceed 100,000.
-----
**Parameters**
- **BED file 1 and 2** are the two BED files to be used to calculate the overlap. - **BED file 3** is the third BED file to be used. It's optional. - **BED file labels** name of the datasets displayed on the diagram leave blank to use the default name - **Pic Height** is the height of the final image. - **Pic Width** is the width of the final image. - **Diagram title** is the title of the final image.
-----
**Outputs**
- **PNG file** is the Venn diagram plot. The numbers of overlapped regions are included in the figure. - **LOG file** is the job log. If you see errors, please attach this in the bug report.
-----
**summary**
For the regions in bed file, it will do a cluster first. For example, we have 5 regions
bed A: (200, 900) (1000, 1200)
bed B: (100, 300) (700, 1100) (1400, 1500)
Since they have overlaps, It will cluster them into 2 regions: (100, 1200) (1400, 1500), and see whether each region (of the 2 regions) is included in bed A or B. So,
(100, 1200) is included in bed A, B
(1400,1500) is included in bed B
Then we draw the venn diagram
